intro: Syngonanthus cowanii var. simplex, commonly known as the simple fringed gentian, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its simple, linear leaves and showy inflorescences make it a distinctive species within its genus. It is often found in mountainous regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
